Package game_logic

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • game_logic.GameLogic
  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds the main logic of the game. It is responsible for managing the game's state, rules, and the interactions between various game objects. This includes handling game progression, events, and collision responses.

    It utilizes objects from the 'gameobjects' package and constants from 'utils.GameConstants' to implement the game mechanics.

    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader,
                 danogl.gui.SoundReader soundReader,
                 danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection gameObjects,
                 danogl.gui.UserInputListener inputListener,
                 danogl.gui.WindowController windowController,
                 danogl.util.Vector2 windowDimensionsVector,
                 danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                 danogl.util.Counter heartNumber,
                 danogl.GameManager gameManager)
        Constructs a new GameLogic object with essential game components.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - Reader for game images.
        soundReader - Reader for game sounds.
        gameObjects - Collection of all game objects.
        inputListener - Listener for user input.
        windowController - Controller for the game window.
        windowDimensionsVector - Dimensions of the game window.
        bricksCounter - Counter for the number of bricks in the game.
        heartNumber - Counter for the player's remaining lives.
        gameManager - The game manager.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(float deltaTime,
                   Ball ball)
        Main update method called each frame to handle game logic.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Time elapsed since the last update.
        ball - The regularBall object in the game.

      • deleteObject

        public void deleteObject​(danogl.GameObject objectToRemove)
        Removes a specified game object from the game. Decrements the brick counter if a brick is removed.
        Parameters:
        objectToRemove - The game object to be removed.

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame()
        Checks for player input to quit the game. If the specific quit key is pressed, the game performs an end-game check.

      • setRandomBallVelocity

        public void setRandomBallVelocity​(Ball ball)
        Sets a random velocity for the regular ball at the start of the game or after a restart.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object whose velocity is to be set.

      • checkForGameEnd

        private void checkForGameEnd()
        Checks for game end conditions such as winning or losing and takes appropriate actions.

      • checkLivesStatus

        private void checkLivesStatus​(Ball ball)
        Checks the status of player lives and handles the restart of the turn if needed.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object representing the player's ball.

      • isObjectIsOutsideBorders

        private boolean isObjectIsOutsideBorders​(danogl.GameObject object)
        Checks if a game object is outside the game borders.
        Parameters:
        object - The game object to check.
        Returns:
        True if the object is outside the borders, false otherwise.

      • restartTurn

        private void restartTurn​(Ball ball)
        Restarts the turn by setting the ball's position and velocity to default values.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object to restart the turn for.
